hackathon-description-text: Hack NYU is all about turning your cool ideas into reality. Whether you want to build the next Twitter or you have an idea to make finding books in Bobst more fun, we want you to build it. So come join us for 36 hours of building and competition.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Associate Dean, Library Information Technology and University Media Services
Executive Director, NYU Digital Communications Group
Professor, CSE Department, NYU Polytechnic School of Engineering
Manager of Marketing, Communications, & Web-Based Technologies, HashtagNYU

hackathon-eligibility: Submit everything by 10am to be eligible for main prizes. Only projects developed over the course of this weekend will be eligible. If you are using projects that were built in the past and are building something new on top of it, you may still be eligible but please let us know ahead of time. We will evaluate only the parts which you made over the weekend.
hackathon-requirements: Make anything you want. Develop something cool that people can use.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: One for every member of the winning team.
One for every member of the winning team.
One for every member of the winning team.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=NYU Polytechnic School of Engineering, 6 MetroTech Roadway, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: The Top 5 Teams after first round judging will expo publicly for final judging.
